intro: Ossaea incerta, commonly known as the uncertain ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
